title: Lefty Estes nearing deal with Padres
subtitle: Lefty Estes nearing deal with Padres
body: In a move that would land a longtime nemesis and inject a left-hander into the starting rotation, free agent Shawn Estes is on the verge of joining the Padres with a one-year deal in excess of $1 million. Vice president and general manager Kevin Towers confirmed that Estes, who suffered a stress fracture in his left ankle in July while pitching for the Diamondbacks, is scheduled to undergo a physical examination Wednesday. "If everything goes well there, he'll be a Padre," said Towers, adding that he remains in conversation with the Red Sox regarding former Padre David Wells, another veteran lefty. Lyle Spencer is a reporter for MLB.com. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Lyle Spencer
